Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: short diagonal strokes between dilute lines at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx (top of head, hair with red and curlicue remaining), to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the first stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. Some sherds in this group have the double-edged saw pattern in the handle zone. In this instance, only the rim of the chalice remains. Those pieces in Lemos' list which do not preserve the saw pattern are all small sherds.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 130, p. 287, no. 844, pl. 118)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1131) (phase 2)
